decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The proposed two storey side extension by reason of its design, siting, form, and height would fail to achieve a high standard of design, failing to respond positively to the character and appearance of the host dwelling, street scene and St Helier Estate by appearing as an incongruous addition, being overly dominant and failing to respect the spacious setting of the site, street scene and area, contrary to Policies D3 & D4 of the London Plan (2021), Policy CS 14 of the Merton LDF Core Planning Strategy (2011) and Policies DM D2 & DM D3 of the Merton Sites and Policies Plan (2014).

Condition : 2 - INFORMATIVE
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:

   i) The application was not considered to comply with the provisions of the Development Plan and NPPF as submitted, and would have required substantial changes such that a new application would be required. 
   ii) The application was considered to be fundamentally contrary to the provisions of the Development Plan and the NPPF, and there were not considered to be any solutions to resolve this conflict. 
   iii) It is noted that the applicant/agent did not engage in any pre-application discussions.
   iv) The applicant is advised to seek pre-application advice on any resubmission.

Reason : 1 - The proposed two storey side extension by reason of its design, siting, form, and height would fail to achieve a high standard of design, failing to respond positively to the character and appearance of the host dwelling, street scene and St Helier Estate by appearing as an incongruous addition, being overly dominant and failing to respect the spacious setting of the site, street scene and area, contrary to Policies D3 & D4 of the London Plan (2021), Policy CS 14 of the Merton LDF Core Planning Strategy (2011) and Policies DM D2 & DM D3 of the Merton Sites and Policies Plan (2014).

Reason : 2 - INFORMATIVE
Note to Applicant
